name: Simple New England Fried Fish
author: Meghan Briggs
summary: This simple recipe works best with cod (scrod) and flounder. The product is a fresh, buttery-tasting fillet. Goes so well with french fries or oven fries (chips).
ingredients: 1 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
1 ½ cups vegetable oil, or more as needed
directions: Stir egg whites and water together with a fork in a wide, shallow bowl
Mix cornmeal, flour, and pepper together with a fork on a plate
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Dip each flounder fillet into the egg white mixture and press into the cornmeal mixture to coat completely
Gently toss between your hands so any cornmeal that hasn't stuck can fall away
Place fish onto a plate while preparing the rest of the fillets; do not stack
Carefully put fish into the hot oil and cook until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes per side
Drain fillets on a plate lined with paper towel; season with salt
